intro: Pentace virginis, commonly known as the Virgin's pentace, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. It typically grows in wetlands and along stream banks, thriving in moist, sandy soils. Due to its habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species in some regions.
